intro: Tricalysia niamniamensis subsp. nodosa, commonly known as the nodular tricalysia, is a shrub native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and understoreys. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and are usually white or pale yellow.
